that they may proclaim the mystery of our glory.

Surrender your being to the seeds of the Spirit
come to join all suffering;
the Body of the Lord is made of the sorrows
of the man crushed by injustice.
Let us surrender our being to the seeds of the Spirit
that he may give us his strength in his service.

Turn your eyes towards the interior Guest
desiring nothing but this presence;
live by the Spirit, to be the one
who gives his Name to your Father.
Let us turn our eyes towards the interior Guest,
for he dwells in our silences and our prayers.

The Spirit,
when He dwells in a man,
never leaves him
once that man has become prayer.
For the Spirit Himself
never ceases to pray within him.
Whether that man sleeps or wakes,
prayer henceforth
does not depart from his soul.

Whether he eats, whether he drinks, whether he sleeps,
whatever he does,
and even in deep sleep,
the perfumes and incense of prayer
rise effortlessly from his heart.

Prayer no longer leaves him.

en_title: To Receive the Gifts of the Holy Spirit
en_content:
O Jesus, who, before ascending into Heaven, promised your apostles to send them the Holy Spirit, to instruct them, console them, and strengthen them, deign to send down upon us also this divine Paraclete.

Come into us, Spirit of the Fear of the Lord; grant that we may fear above all else to grieve our heavenly Father and that we may flee the deceitful allurements of the pleasures of the senses.

Come into us, Spirit of Piety; fill our hearts with the most filial tenderness for God and with the most perfect meekness towards our brethren.

Come into us, Spirit of Knowledge; enlighten us on the vanity of the things of this world; grant that, seeing in them images of the divine perfections, we may use them to raise our hearts towards Him who created them for our service.

Come into us, Spirit of Fortitude; give us the courage to bear with patience the sufferings and trials of life, and grant that we may generously overcome all the obstacles that would stand in the way of the fulfillment of our duties.

Come into us, Spirit of Counsel; grant us the grace to discern, in difficult situations, what we must do to accomplish the will of God, and what we must say to guide prudently those of whom we are the guides.

Come into us, Spirit of Understanding; may your divine light cause us to penetrate the truths and mysteries of religion, and may it make our faith so lively that it may be the inspiration of all our sentiments and of all our actions.

Come into us, Spirit of Wisdom; grant that we may taste the sweetness of divine things to such an extent that our heart may love them solely and that it may draw from this love an unalterable peace.

Glory be to the Father who created us, to the Son who redeemed us, to the Holy Spirit who sanctified us.

Amen.

O Holy Spirit,
Love of the Father and the Son,
inspire me always
what I ought to think,
what I ought to say,
how I ought to say it,
what I ought to keep silent,
what I ought to write,
how I ought to act,
what I ought to do,
to procure your glory,
the good of souls,
and my own sanctification.

O God, Father of lights,
true light comes from you: it is Christ,
Light of the world whom you sent here below
to illuminate our lives.
Send now this Light into our souls,
that we may know you,
that in knowing you we may love you,
and that through your love
we may attain to your blessedness.

Spirit of wisdom, come into us
and lead us to perfection.
You who attest to our spirit
that we are children of God,
grant that we may experience the riches of his grace,
so that we may acquire a taste for it
and thereby find true spiritual joy.
You who search the depths of the Godhead,
give us an intimate knowledge
of the depths of God,
so that we may cling to him with all our heart
and become one spirit with Him.

Amen

Holy Spirit,

Make me strive for the holiness
to which God calls me.

Make me live in that holiness,
since by dwelling in my soul,
you cause divine holiness to abide there.

May your holiness take ever greater
possession of my being,
expanding it into the very life of God!

As each confession
causes your grace of pardon and renewal
to penetrate more deeply within me,
may it be the origin of a greater effort
towards a more generous holiness!

Deign to purify the depths of my heart,
free it from the passions
that would seize it,
liberate it from evil inclinations.

Deign to recreate me into a new man,
recreate my thoughts so that they adhere to God,
recreate my feelings and my will
so that they are fixed in him.

Make me capable of accomplishing
what I have been unable to do until now,
by communicating to me a strength
that elevates me above myself.

Draw me into the impetus of your love,
and animate the soaring of my spiritual life
with your divine breath!

Holy Spirit, You are the fire that the risen Jesus kindled on the earth for humanity to reveal the immeasurable Love of the Father.

Burn still today in the hearts of young people, so that, leaving everything to follow Christ, they may discover the true joy of disciples.

Send them forth among their brothers and sisters, priests at the service of the people of God.

Send them into the heart of the world, men and women with apostolic hearts.

Send them beyond borders, witnesses consumed by missionary zeal.

Send them into the silence of the desert, passionate seekers of the living God.

Spirit of Love, grant all these young people the courage to answer the call of the Father and the Church.

And may Mary, humble servant of the Lord, accompany them on this path of light and life.

Breath of God's love,
Holy Spirit,
You deposit faith in the depths of our soul.
It is like a surge of trust
taken up a thousand times in the course of our life.
It can only be a very simple trust,
so simple that all of us can welcome it.

Most Gracious Holy Spirit
I offer You my will,
so that You may warm it
and inflame it with Your Divine Love.

Open my soul to Your Seven Gifts,
and restore to me Your temple of purity.

Fill me with Your graces
and prepare my heart
to receive my God.

en_title: Spirit of Wisdom, Light, and Strength, Spirit of Love
en_content:
Holy Spirit,
place in the hearts of all believers in the world
the fraternal love that will allow them to meet
in a spirit of exchange and sharing
beyond their differences.
May each one learn to discover the riches of the other.

Holy Spirit,
teach us to listen to each other
with patience and humility,
so that each of our encounters becomes a crossroads
where each receives as much as they give,
even if we come from very different paths.

Holy Spirit,
give us the strength of faith and gather us
in a common will to evangelize.
"The good news is proclaimed to the poor."
Teach us the joy of faith, of hope,
of love that transforms the world
and frees every person from their sins,
from their spiritual or material miseries.

Holy Spirit,
make of each baptized person a ray of your light,
so that the world of the year 2000
may discover your presence and your love.
The whole world is my village,
the universe is my parish:
push each one towards the deep,
towards the civilization of love
where what unites us will free us from what divides us.

en_title: You Have Already Opened the Ways
en_content:
Spirit of the risen Christ, Holy Spirit,
if only we knew what to ask of you
to pray as we ought!
But behold, the stammerings
of our prayer pass through the crucible of our poverty,
of our little faith.

Then You, the living God,
enter into our poor soul,
You enter into our weakness and read in our hearts
our authentic intentions.
And Your Spirit comes within us, He comes to express
the inexpressible through humble words, and sighs,
and silences.
And You say to us: "Do not worry about anything, do not fret
about your little capacity to pray.
Know this, in your prayerful waiting,
I have already opened the paths."

Thus, You grant us to understand
that You call each one by name,
that You awaken inner springs,
that You have deposited in each one a unique, irreplaceable gift.
Our eyes open and, in poor prayer,
we understand that man is only fulfilled
in the presence of God.

Where families are divided by internal crises and where children are forced to go down into the street to struggle to survive.
Where more resources are spent on weapons and acts of mass destruction and where less attention is paid to disease and hunger.

Come Holy Spirit
Heal our wounds
Renew all creation!

Where the purchase of material goods has become an obsession and where the value of the human being is measured by what he possesses,
Where the air, the trees and the oceans are assailed by pollution and where blind and mercenary greed threatens our environment.

Come Holy Spirit
Heal our wounds
Renew all creation!

Where countries are divided by separatism and racism and where the blood of innocents is shed by absurd acts of terrorism,
Where wars of mutual destruction pit entire nations against each other and where nuclear holocaust appears ominously on our horizon.

Come Holy Spirit
Heal our wounds
Renew all creation!

Come, Holy Spirit,
and deign to make yourself my inner Master.
Give me a true filial spirit towards the Father,
a great confidence in his paternal goodness,
a total, active and passive adherence to his Will,
an immense gratitude for his graces.
Come and suggest all things to me.
Remind me of what Jesus said.
Help my weakness, supply my deficiencies,
come and fulfill in me my mission of continual prayer;
for what would my prayer be worth
if it were not inspired and made worthy by You.

Amen.

Come, Holy Spirit!
Enlighten my understanding
so that I may know your commandments,
strengthen my heart
against the snares of the enemy,
inflame my will.
I have heard your voice and do not want to harden myself
nor resist by saying: later..., tomorrow.
Nunc coepi! Now!
Lest there be no tomorrow.

O Spirit of truth and wisdom,
Spirit of understanding and counsel,
Spirit of joy and peace!
I want what You want,
I want because You want,
I want as You want,
I want when You want...

Holy Mary, Seat of Wisdom,
pray for me.
Saint Joseph, my father and lord,
pray for me.
My guardian angel,
pray for me.

en_title: Make the Splendor of Your Glory Shine Forth
en_content:
Come, Holy Spirit,
And cause the splendor of Your light to shine forth.
Come, Father of the poor,
Come, Spirit of generosity,
Come, Light of hearts,
And cause the splendor of Your light to shine forth.
You, the perfect consoler,
Wonderful refreshment.
In us, You cause peace to dwell.
In sorrow, You are rest,
In trial, strength,
In sadness, consolation.
Beneficent Light,
Penetrate the depths of our hearts,
For we are faithful to You.
Without Your presence, in man
There is nothing that is pure.
Wash away our sin,
Quench our dryness,
Heal our wound,
Bend our rigidity,
Inflame our coldness,
Correct our straying.
To those who trust in You
And receive You in faith,
Grant all Your gifts.
Grant them to grow in You,
And to persevere in salvation.
Grant them the joy that abides.

Amen.

ALLELUIA!

en_title: Come, Holy Spirit, into our hearts
en_content:
Come, Holy Spirit, fill the hearts of your faithful
and enkindle in them the fire of your love.

Come, Father of the poor.
Come, Giver of gifts.
Come, Light of our hearts.

Greatest of consolers,
sweet guest of the soul,
gentle refreshment.

In labor, rest;
in fever, coolness;
in tears, comfort.

O blessed Light,
fill the inmost being
of all your faithful.

Apart from your divine power,
there is nothing in man,
nothing that is not harmful.

Wash what is unclean,
water what is arid,
heal what is wounded.

Make supple what is rigid,
warm what is cold,
correct what is crooked.

Grant to your faithful
who trust in you
the sevenfold gifts.

Grant virtue and merit,
grant a holy death,
grant everlasting joy.

Amen.

Fire and Light that shines upon the face of Christ,
Fire whose coming is word,
Fire whose silence is light,
Fire who establishes hearts in thanksgiving,
We magnify you.

You who rest in Christ,
Spirit of wisdom and understanding,
Spirit of counsel and fortitude,
Spirit of knowledge and fear of the Lord,
We magnify you.

You who search the depths,
You who illumine the eyes of our heart,
You who join yourself to our spirit,
You through whom we reflect the glory of the Lord,
We magnify you.

en_title: Novena to the Holy Spirit (to be prayed between the Ascension and Pentecost)
en_content:
Between the time of the Ascension and Pentecost, the Church, in prayer with the Virgin Mary and the Apostles, invites each faithful person to invoke the Holy Spirit in a special way. Holy Scripture attests that, during the nine days that separate the Ascension from Pentecost, the Apostles "with one accord devoted themselves to prayer, together with the women and Mary the Mother of Jesus" (Acts 1:14), waiting to be "clothed with power from on high" (Luke 24:49). Let us not be afraid to seize the great graces that are offered to us by making this novena of Saint Alphonsus Liguori.

First day: To ask for the gift of Fear of the Lord

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Your Fear, so that it may serve as a brake to never fall back into my past faults, for which I ask a thousand times for forgiveness.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Second day: To ask for the gift of Piety

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Piety, so that I may in the future serve You with more fervor, follow Your holy inspirations with more promptness, and observe Your divine precepts more exactly.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Third day: To ask for the gift of Knowledge

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Knowledge, so that I may know well the things of God, and that, enlightened by Your holy instructions, I may walk, without ever deviating, in the way of my eternal salvation.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Fourth day: To ask for the gift of Fortitude

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Fortitude, so that I may courageously overcome all the attacks of the demon and all the dangers of the world, which oppose the salvation of my soul.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Fifth day: To ask for the gift of Counsel

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Counsel, so that I may choose well all that is most suitable for my spiritual advancement and discover all the traps and all the ruses of the tempting spirit.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Sixth day: To ask for the gift of Understanding

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I adore You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Understanding, so that I may understand well the divine mysteries, and, through the contemplation of heavenly things, detach my thoughts and my affections from all the vanities of this miserable world.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Seventh day: To ask for the gift of Wisdom

Holy Spirit, divine Consoler! I love You as my true God, as well as God the Father and God the Son. I offer You my heart and give You fervent thanks for all the benefits that You have poured out and continue to pour out into the world. You who are the Author of all supernatural gifts and who have filled the soul of the Blessed Mother of God and of all consolation, Mary, with immense favors, I beg You to visit me by Your grace and to grant me the gift of Wisdom, so that I may direct all my actions well, referring them to God as my ultimate end, so that in loving and serving Him as I ought in this life, I may have the happiness of possessing Him eternally in the other.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Eighth day: Humble supplication

Holy Spirit, divine Paraclete, Father of the poor, Consoler of the afflicted, Light of hearts, Sanctifier of souls, behold me prostrate in Your presence; I adore You with the most profound submission and I repeat a thousand times, with the Seraphim who stand before Your throne: "Holy! Holy! Holy!". I firmly believe that You are eternal, proceeding from the Father and the Son. I hope that, by Your goodness, You will sanctify and save my soul. I love You, O God of love! I love You more than anything; I love You with all my affections, because You are an infinite goodness which alone deserves all love; and since, insensitive to Your holy inspirations, I have had the ingratitude to offend You by so many sins, I ask You a thousand pardons and I supremely regret having saddened You, O Infinite Love.

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Ninth day: Offering and invocations

I offer You my heart, cold as it is, and I beg You to send into it a ray of Your light and a spark of Your fire, to melt the hard ice of these iniquities. You who have filled the soul of the Blessed Virgin Mary with immense graces, and inflamed the hearts of the Apostles with a holy zeal, deign also to inflame my heart. - Vinum non habent. May the Blessed Virgin Mary, who obtained the wine of infinite Love, obtain for us the wine of infinite Love, which filled the Apostles with ecstasy on the holy day of Pentecost. May the Holy Spirit, through Mary, raise up new apostles filled with the love of Jesus Christ. You are a divine Spirit, strengthen me against evil spirits; You are a Fire, kindle in me the fire of Your love; You are a light, make me know eternal things; You are a Dove, give me pure morals; You are a Breath full of gentleness, dissipate the storms that my passions stir up in me; You are a Tongue, teach me how to praise You without ceasing; You are a Cloud, cover me with the shadow of Your protection. Author of all heavenly gifts, ah! I implore You, vivify me by Your grace, sanctify me by Your charity, govern me by Your wisdom, adopt me as Your child and save me by Your infinite mercy, so that I may never cease to bless You, to praise You and to love You, first on earth during my life, and then in Heaven throughout eternity. - Amen

One Our Father, one Hail Mary, and three Glory be.

Soul of Christ, sanctify me.
Body of Christ, save me.
Blood of Christ, inebriate me.
Water from the side of Christ, wash me.
Passion of Christ, strengthen me.
O good Jesus, hear me.
Within Thy wounds hide me.
Permit me not to be separated from Thee.
From the enemy defend me.
At the hour of my death call me.
Bid me come unto Thee.
That with Thy saints I may praise Thee.
Forever and ever.

Amen.

Lord Jesus, teach us to be generous,
To serve you as you deserve,
To give and not to count the cost,
To fight and not to heed the wounds,
To toil and not to seek for rest,
To labor and not to ask for any reward,
Save that of knowing that we do your holy will.

Lord Jesus, flood me with Your Spirit and Your Life.
Take possession of my whole being so that my life may be
but a reflection of Your own.

Shine through me, dwell in me, so that everyone I meet
may sense Your presence in me.

Looking at me, may they see no one but You alone, Lord!
Abide in me and then I will be able, like You, to radiate,

to the point of being in turn a light for others.
Thus my life will become a praise to Your glory,
the praise that You prefer, in making Yourself radiate
on those around us.

Through the radiant fullness of the love
that my heart bears for You.

Amen.

ME:

What does it matter if I must drink a bitter chalice,
And if I feel my heart sorrowful unto death:
Since it is You, JESUS, who wills the sacrifice,
I do not count.

At Your pleasure, my JESUS, let the veil fall,
Show me Your beauty, hold me in Your arms,
Or from the darkened sky steal every star:
I do not count.

Give me, my JESUS, Your peace or the tempest,
Crown my efforts, or do not sustain me,
Under the weight of sorrows let my head bow:
I do not count.

Let my heart be wounded, even by those whom I love,
What does it matter, my JESUS, since You will love me!
Let the good that I do be suspected itself:
I do not count.

If with incessant labors You will that I honor You,
Or if I must languish in helplessness, alas!
What does it matter, my JESUS! You will it: I adore You!
I do not count.

If I must finish climbing Calvary,
If even the Cyrenian fails my steps,
What does it matter, my JESUS! You will see my misery.
I do not count.

JESUS:

If your faith, dear child, is so great and so high,
If you wish to forget yourself to live in my arms,
I know, I can, I love you and I count,
If you do not count!

ME:

What does my pleasure, my joy, my suffering matter!
Jesus alone must count in my heart here below.
To Him alone glory, love, recognition:
I do not count.

O You who knew how to create the heart of Mothers,
I find in You the most tender of Fathers!
My only Love, Jesus, Eternal Word,
For me Your heart is more than maternal.
At every moment, You follow me, You keep me,
When I call upon You, ah! You never delay,
And if at times You seem to hide Yourself,
It is You who comes to help me seek You.

It is to You alone, Jesus, that I cling,
It is in Your arms that I run and hide,
I want to love You like a little child,
I want to fight like a valiant warrior,
Like a child full of tenderness,
I want, Lord, to fill You with caresses,
And in the field of my apostolate,
Like a warrior, I launch myself into combat!...

Your heart, which guards and restores innocence,
Could not betray my trust!
In You, Lord, rests my hope,
After exile, in Heaven, I will go to see You....
When in my heart the storm arises,
Toward You, Jesus, I raise my head,
In Your merciful gaze,
I read: "Child, for you, I made the Heavens."

I know well, my sighs and my tears
Are before You, all radiant with charms.
The Seraphim in Heaven form Your court,
And yet, You beg for my love!...
You want my heart, Jesus, I give it to You,
All my desires, I abandon them to You,
And those whom I love, O my Spouse, my King,
I no longer want to love them except for You.

My only peace, my only happiness,
My only Love, it is You, Lord!...

Lord Jesus,
Who offer Yourself to us as the living way,
All irradiated by the light from on high,
Deign to join us on the path of life,
As You once did for the travelers to Emmaus.
Grant us a share in Your Spirit, so that
We may discover the way of Your greatest Service
And that, nourished by the Host, true bread for travelers,
We may journey joyfully, despite weariness and contradictions,
On the road that leads straight to the Father's house.

Amen.

O Jesus, You Who love me so much, hidden God, but truly present on this altar, hear me, I implore You.

May Your good pleasure be my pleasure, my passion, my love! Grant me to seek it, to find it, to accomplish it. Show me Your ways, point out Your paths to me. You have Your designs upon me, tell them to me clearly, and grant me to follow them, until, by Your grace, the salvation of my soul is assured. Indifferent to all that happens, and wanting to see only You, may I love all that is Yours, but You above all, my God! Make bitter to me every joy that is not from You, impossible every desire outside of You; delightful every work done for You, unbearable every rest that is not in You. May my life, O good Jesus, be but an act of love toward You.

Amen.

en_title: Lord, If You Look at Me...
en_content:
Lord, if you look upon me,
and I know that you look upon me,
do not see the coward,
the proud, or the wicked...
But the small flame always burning in the depths of my heart,
which only asks to set ablaze my whole soul
and my whole body to serve you.

en_title: Grant us the uprightness of the great fir tree.
en_content:
Lord Jesus, grant that we may have the uprightness of the tall fir tree, reaching straight to heaven,
May our generosity be like the sap that rises and nourishes,
May our souls have the clarity of the streams that are born of the spotless snow,
May our will be like flawless granite,
May You be the companion of our wanderings on all the roads of our lives,
May the cross that stands at the crossroads be for us like the encounter with a friend,

And this, always...

Glorious Christ,
You are the dazzling Center
where the countless fibers
of the manifold are joined.
Your hands hold captive the stars.
You are the first and the last,
the living, the dead, and the risen.
You gather into your unity
all powers, all states.
It is you I call upon
with a desire as vast as the universe:
You are truly my Lord and my God!

en_title: Fill my heart with the Beatitudes.
en_content:
Lord Jesus,
fill my heart with the Beatitudes,
create in me a heart of the poor,
a heart open to receive and to give.

Create in me a heart overflowing with tenderness,
wholly clothed in Your forgiveness
to cover others with it.

Give me a simple and good gaze
that is enlightened by every child's gaze.

Give me a heart of peace that reassures my brothers and sisters,
a generous heart ready to fight
for all the great causes of humanity
and those of the Kingdom of Heaven.

Lord Jesus, Transparency of the Father,
give me a heart of flesh
irradiated with Your Spirit of Love.
Lord Jesus, fill my heart with Your joy...

Amen.

You who have loved your own
as no man ever loved on this earth,
You made us, in leaving the earth,
the comforting promise
to remain with us until the end of time.

Now You dwell hidden in our midst.
At all times and in all places flow forth from your tent
consolation, light and strength into the souls here below
who take refuge with You.
They look with love towards the small Host,
silent image of purity and peace.
Yet, in the hearts of those who love You,
never is silenced the ardent desire to see You in person,
You, the fairest of the sons of men,
in your bodily form. (...)

And now, in these latter times,
when faith, hope, and love have disappeared,
You have uncovered your Holy Face,
the Face of Him who suffered on the Cross
and closed His eyes in the sleep of death.

As behind a veil we see the suffering
in these holy, sublime features.
This suffering - surpassing all human measure -
is so great that we can
neither grasp it nor penetrate it.
Yet You suffered silently
and in You was a strength that mastered the excess of suffering.
You were its Lord when You gave Yourself over to it.
An unfathomable and profound peace flows from these features and says:
All is accomplished.

Upon him to whom You unite Yourself eternally
You cast the mysterious veil:
he bears with You Your suffering and suffers as You,
hidden, silent and deeply at peace.

I love you, oh my Jesus,
I love you with that Love which does not belong to me
I love you with that Love which comes only from You
I love you with that Love that you give me freely

Jesus, in the most holy Sacrament,
you allow me to come and be refreshed in this Love
In praise you come to give me your strength, your comfort
In sickness you come to meet me
You, the living Host in the sacrament of the sick.
Lord, You make yourself very close to me at all times!

You give yourself to me on the Cross
to free me from sin,
You give me your Holy Spirit
so that He may protect me,
You give me a guardian angel
as an advocate every day to defend me,
You give me your mother
so that she may be mine,
You give me Saints
to serve as an example to me,
You give me brothers and sisters
to manifest your love to me,
You give me the earth as an inheritance
so that I may experience my nature
as prince(ss) of your kingdom,
You give me the sacraments
to sanctify me,
You give me a taste of your mercy
to be even closer to you,
You give me your Love
so that I can love.

What goodness, O Jesus!?
What goodness to give me all this
and only ask in return that I may Love
What is Love,
if not being happy and even blessed.
Lord, you give me everything that is dear to you
freely, without asking for anything in return.
What Love!? What Goodness!?

I love you Jesus because I can only love you,
I am made to love you and I only want to love you!
I love you oh, my Jesus!
I love you Lord
and I want to continue to love you at all times,
in every place and in every circumstance.
I love you with that Love that you alone can give!

Jesus.
A name?
Much more. In itself alone, a prayer.
A whisper when the heart
pours out its overflowing love.
A cry having a strange power
of appeasement in moments of anguish.
A call when one no longer finds the way.
A joyful interjection
in moments of fullness.

Jesus.
I too want to "call upon your name."
May it be on my lips
at the moment I leave this life.

Jesus, You are present
When Your Spirit descends
Upon the bread and wine
These are divine gifts.
And then You are there,
Not in a beyond,
Here and now,
You are taking hold of man.
You give Yourself entirely,
Without blame and without pity,
For the people gathered.
In the beginning of the wheat,
The grain giving the bread
That we hold in our hand
Has become Your body
That we still share
With each participant
Who depends entirely on You.

Lord Jesus, my guide and my friend,
You have opened to me all the paths of the world;
You have gone before me on every road
So that I may never be without light.

When I am alone,
I remember you, praying in the desert;
When I am poor,
I relive your birth in the night of Christmas;
When I am afflicted,
I see you again near Lazarus.

There is not a path in life
That you have not taken before me.

When I feel betrayed,
I remember that someone delivered you up;
When I suffer injustice,
I think of you before your judges;
When anguish grips me,
Your agony is before my eyes;
And when death troubles my peace,
I look upon you on the Cross.

Thus, Jesus, you are my guide,
My leader on the rope
On the mountain of Tabor.

You are also my model;
Just by looking at you, I know!
I know how to love,
I know how to suffer,
How to live out God’s great plan.

May your strength now
Be added to your light
So that I may make your face visible
In the present world.

Lord,
make me know
what you expect of me,
amidst the troubles of this world
and amidst my own troubles.

You have fashioned me
through the meanderings of my life.
Like a river,
my life has carved its bed
upon the earth of humans.
Have I arrived at the River
to mingle there,
to melt into it?

You are the River,
I am the river.
You draw me,
and I slip into you
a little more
each day.

Forever!

Thank you!

My God of every day
and of every hour,
I ask you for a special favor:
never let me be indifferent
to one of your wonders!

Let me rejoice in the miracle of each awakening,
in the miracle of knowing that I am still alive,
in the miracle of breathing, walking, and thinking,
in the miracle of your love and your mercy.

Help me never to tire of your seasons:
spring is a miracle,
summer is a miracle,
autumn is a miracle,
winter is a beautiful miracle.
Every day is a miracle, as is every night.

Thank you for the beauty of this region, Lord.
Thank you for the sunrise and the sunset.
Thank you for the moon and the stars.

Grant me this gift, Lord:
the gift of appreciating you
and all that you do.
One day I will ask you for the supreme gift
of loving you as I should,
more than yesterday... and less than tomorrow.

Let us pray with joy to the Lord Jesus Christ,
Bread of our life:

Blessed are you, Lord, for your body and your blood!

O Christ, you have told us to give thanks
in memory of you:

- Keep us faithful to celebrating this mystery.

Priest of the New Covenant,
you offered the perfect sacrifice on the altar of the cross:

- Grant us the grace to offer ourselves with you in faith.

You, the manna come from heaven,
nourish the Church by your body and your blood:

- Strengthen her on her journey towards the Father.

You are the Bread sent by the Father for our healing:

- Restore health to bodies and souls.

You have entrusted to us the Eucharist
to proclaim your death and resurrection:

- Give eternal life to those who await your return.

Lord Jesus Christ, in this wondrous sacrament,
you have left us a memorial of your Passion;
grant that we may venerate with so great a love
the mystery of your body and your blood
that we may continually gather
the fruit of your Redemption.
You who reign for ever and ever.

Amen

O Lord, God of all deliverances,
We have seen how good you are,
Wholly, totally, and definitively good,

We have seen that you could not,
No, truly not, be other than good.
And that is why we are here,
Before you today.

We have seen you,
We have smiled at you and you have smiled at us.
We have given you all our joy,
And you have given us all your peace.

Our joy knew no end,
You rejoiced in our joy,
And we sang Alleluia.

And our lungs were too weak to cry out our joy
So we gave our joy,
Danced, danced all our joy
We gave you everything,
And you gave us everything.
We gave you all our sadness,
And you gave us all your joy.
We gave you all our torment,
And you gave us all your peace.

May our whole beings sing their joy to you.
So that with all my soul I may go in search of you,
For without you I am deprived of all good.

O Lord my God,
grant that the poor creature that I am
may praise you, give you thanks.

Thank you for having created me,
thank you for having called me from nothingness to life,
thank you for having loved me from the day of my conception.

O my God, my praise adds nothing to your greatness,
to your power, to your magnificence, to what you are.
You are the God of Love, good, faithful eternally.

Teach me to love,
to love with all my heart
and with all my understanding.
Teach me to do your will,
Teach me to renounce and flee from sin,

Strengthen me, for I am weak
and without you, Lord, I can do nothing,

Teach me to die to sin
and to rise to a holy, merciful life
that will have no end.

Teach me to adore you with a true, sincere, pure heart
and to recognize your face
in that of each of my brothers and sisters,

Open my eyes, Lord, to the wonders of your creation,

Give me the grace to contemplate your holy face
through your works, Lord,

Yes, Lord,
how beautiful and magnificent are your works,

Yes, Lord,
I want to live to adore you and love my neighbor,

I desire so much that, in the name of your Son Jesus Christ,
the sinful, old and bad creature may die,
so that a new creature may be born who loves you,
works for the radiance of your glory,
of your Holy Name in every place and at all times,

I want to live to adore you,
to act for the happiness of my brothers and sisters,

Of my sorrows and my joys,
I have no concern for them, for everything is yours, everything is in you,

In you, I want to know the happiness of loving,
of forgiving, of opening myself to others,
of being your unprofitable servant,
who never ceases to love his master and serve him,

Living to glorify you, to honor you in everything,
to love my neighbor,

Living for you and in you, dying of Love for you,

Living, dying by Love for you
and rising in the Love that has no end,

Yes, Lord, such is the deep desire of my heart,
which in you abandons itself and expects everything from you,

Living and dying in Christ.

Amen

You are the only Holy One, Lord God,
You who work wonders!

You are strong,
You are great,
You are the Most High,
You are the Almighty,
You, Holy Father,
King of heaven and earth.

You are three
and you are one,
Lord God, total Good,
You are the only Good,
You are all Good,
You are the supreme Good,
Lord God living and true.

You are charity, love,
You are wisdom,
You are humility,
You are patience,
You are security,
You are rest,
You are joy and gladness,
You are justice and measure,
You are riches and abundance.

You are beauty,
You are gentleness,
You are our shelter,
You are our guardian and our defender,
You are strength,
You are refreshment.

You are our hope,
You are our faith,
You are our great sweetness,
You are our eternal life,
Great and admirable Lord,
Almighty God,
Sweet and merciful Savior.

en_title: Teach me, Lord, to say thank you.
en_content:
Teach me, Lord, to say thank you
unreservedly and without ceasing,
until my last breath.

Thank you for bread, wind, earth, and water,
Thank you for music and for silence,
Thank you for the miracle of each new day,
Thank you for gestures and words of tenderness,
Thank you for attentiveness and thoughtfulness,
Thank you for laughter and for smiles,
Thank you for all that helps me to live
despite rebellions and failures,
Thank you for all those whom I love and who love me.

And may these thousand thanks be transformed
into an immense act of thanksgiving
when I turn towards You,
the Source of all grace and the Rock of my life.
Thank you for Your Love without limit,
Thank you for the Peace that comes from You,
Thank you for the Bread of the Eucharist,
Thank you for the freedom that You give.

With my brothers and sisters, I proclaim Your praise
for our life which is in Your hands,
for our souls which are entrusted to You,
for the blessings with which You shower us
and which we do not always know how to see.

Good and Merciful God,
may Your Name be blessed forever.

Thank you for all that exists,
Joy, friendship, happiness
Thank you for all that you create,
Love, peace, equality
Thank you for what I can give,
My joy, my listening, my help
Thank you for what you can give,
Through me, justice and fraternity
Thank you for these words I use,
They are what I feel
Thank you for this poem I write,
It is to celebrate and to pray to you
Thank you for this imperfect world,
It is up to us to bring what is lacking
Thank you because you are there,
You help me to build it better.

When life is a burden,
when our nights are filled with nightmares,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for being present within us.

When sickness strikes us,
when trials are heavy to bear,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for reaching out to us.

When we are without hope,
when everything is dark on the horizon,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for bringing us your light.

When we are alone and forgotten,
when we are afraid to love and be loved,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for offering us your love.

en_title: Thank You for Being There When Life is a Chore
en_content:
When life is a chore,
when our nights are filled with nightmares,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for being present in us.

When illness strikes us,
when trials are heavy to bear,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for reaching out to us.

When we are without hope,
when everything is dark on the horizon,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for bringing us your light.

When we are alone and forgotten,
when we are afraid to love and be loved,
thank you for being there, Lord, and for offering us your love.

Lord, for today: thank you.
Thank you, Lord, for this day that begins,
Thank you for filling the void.
Thank you for confirming that I can continue to hope.
Thank you for all these wonders
that you have created and made available to me.

It is true, Lord, that I do not always understand,
but if you were human, would you understand in turn?
Lord, fill my heart with love.
Despite the wounds of this life,
grant me in this day peace and harmony
and may the sun shine in the heart of every person
encountered today.

Thank you, Lord, for your splendors.
Thank you for your Greatness.
Accompany me today
and all the days of my life....

en_title: Thank You, Lord, for the Little Joys
en_content:
Thank you, Lord, for the small joys;
the great ones are too dear.

Thank you for the sun that strikes my window;
for a smile received; for a word of hope
or for a single moment of well-being and peace!
I have not merited my sorrows
but have not merited these joys.

Thank you for these small gifts
that help me endure the difficult hours.
If I were to add them up,
perhaps, I would find a new way
to understand my life.

Thank you for these small joys
that allow me to glimpse the other side of things:
in suffering, there is love;
in combat, there is life;
in the darkness, faith is discovered.
Nothing is ever completely black
in this hardened world.

Through these small joys, I can prepare myself
for that perfect joy for which you made me
and believe in your Kingdom.

While awaiting that day, open my eyes
to all that is good,
to all that is beautiful,
even if it is fleeting.

May I, by dint of smiling at passing happiness,
become in my turn
a "small joy" for those who no longer believe.

en_title: O Father, to You be praise!
en_content:
O Father, to You be praise!
You show Your path to the humble
but You hide it from the eyes of the wise
so that in the trial of hunger
they may seek Your face.

O Father, to You be praise!
It is in You alone that is our joy
since You always receive us
when, wretched and without love,
we return to You.

O Father, to You be praise!
For You know our weakness
like a mother You carry us
and at every moment You caress us
with Your mercy.

O Father, to You be praise!
For Your Love is infinite.
You will for us holiness
and You give it to the little ones
in Your Beloved Son.

Lord, my God, open my lips:
place in my heart a new song.

The song of one who receives himself from your hand:
"It was you who knit me together
in my mother's womb:
I acknowledge before you the wonder that I am!"

The song whose music awakens the dawn:
"My heart is ready;
I will sing, I will play hymns."

The song of the baptized who have crossed the sea:
"We have escaped the hunter's net:
the net is broken: we have escaped!"

The song of the abandoned one who finds his own again:
"I will proclaim your name to my brethren,
I will praise you in the midst of the assembly."

The song of the unfortunate one who questions the darkness:
"Will the Lord only reject?
Will he never be favorable?"

The song of the beloved who falls asleep in your peace:
"You have put more joy in my heart
than all the vintages and their harvests!"

The song of the little ones who see your Kingdom coming:
"Let the rivers clap their hands,
let the mountains sing for joy!"

The song of the sinner happy for your forgiveness:
"I will give thanks to the Lord
by confessing my sins.
With songs of deliverance you have surrounded me."

The song of the child who learns everything from his mother:
"My soul magnifies the Lord,
my spirit rejoices in God, my Savior!"

Lord, my God, open my lips,
and my mouth will declare your praise.

Heavenly Father, thank you!
You have chosen us;
You have desired each one of us, thank you!
Through You, each receives his life
as a unique stone,
a magnificent stone
that comes to build up the Body of Your Son.

Heavenly Father, thank you
for the Holy Spirit who sustains us,
for the Church who accompanies us
and helps us to find the place
where our stone will be most beautiful,
where each will give as in transparency
this love that he receives from You.

I do not see how I could live
without giving you thanks!
How to live without putting you at the center of my life!
How to live without praising you!
How not to love you, O God Creator!
How to live Your Love
without constantly returning to The Source!
My heart is poor and very small...
it contains little space and needs you at every moment.

To live without you would be to die, for You are my Source.
You fill my smallness each day...
the smaller I am, the greater you are.
So, Lord, make me small...

Each day I discover a new face of Your Countenance,
and that allows me to contemplate you
ever more lovingly!
Is this Love, this inner well-being
when I think of my Beloved?
That instant of limpid flight where we no longer feel the wind
that cracks our wings, but the air becoming a caress
on our whole being?
That warm breath that makes us want to cry out?
That rest of the soul that pushes us to praise?
That Word left by the wayside,
ready to leap at the moment when it can be received
like a flower and understood
by the poor heart of man!

Amen.

Lord, you came, you asked everything of me, and I gave you everything.
I loved to read, and now I am blind.
I loved to run in the woods, and now my legs are paralyzed.
I loved to pick flowers in the spring sunshine, and I no longer have hands.
Because I am a woman, I loved to look at the beauty of my hair, the fineness of my fingers, the grace of my body: now, I am almost bald, and in place of my beautiful slender fingers, I have only rigid pieces of wood.

Look, Lord, how my graceful body is damaged.
But I do not rebel. I give you thanks. For all Eternity I will say THANK YOU to you because if I die this night, I know that my life has been wonderfully well-filled.
In living Love, I have been filled far beyond what my heart desired, O my Father.
How good you have been to your little Veronica, and this evening, O my Love, I pray for the lepers of the whole world.

I pray especially for those whom moral leprosy strikes down, destroys, mutilates, and fells. Those especially, I love, and I offer myself in silence for them, because they are my brothers and sisters.
O my Love, I give you my physical leprosy so that they may no longer know the disgust, bitterness, and coldness of their moral leprosy.

I am your little girl, O my Father, lead me by the hand, as a mother leads her baby.
Press me to your heart like a Father.
Plunge me into the abyss of your heart and may I remain there with all those I love for all Eternity.

You are truly
the Most Merciful of the most merciful!
I thank You for having conferred upon Your servants
and Your devoted handmaidens,
Fervor and Flame.
Yes, You have allowed them to become
beacons for humanity.

Glory be to You eternally.
Blessed are You for having guided me
towards this Holy Spirit of Love,
who humbles Himself and
gives Himself in sacrifice,
Such is the True Nature,
blessed above all,
by whom every disciple is saved
and becomes, in His image, well-intentioned.

You have led me, glory be to You,
to the knowledge of this pure Nature
that You are,
and I shall never fail
and in no case to say that It is fictitious,
and by It I will fight and die
for and in conscience,
against oppressors and Satan.

Through Its knowledge, which has appeared to me
by Your Pure Unmotivated Mercy,
I declare to You that I am ready to follow It everywhere
even into the snares of humiliation,
exploitation of my naivety, and death.

"Better to be the least of the servants of Love
than the greatest of the servants of hate."

Such is my declaration of faith to my God
and my real conversion.
Amen

en_title: A Few Words to Say Thank You
en_content: Lord, accept our prayer of this day. This prayer to say "Thank you!". First, thank you...

Just 10 minutes ago,
I was in sorrow
because I was still worried
about tomorrow.

Just 2 minutes ago,
You made me see the faith and
the hope of all those
who trust in You.

And now, behold,
I am in Joy,
because You are everything to me!
I want to glorify Your name
for the joy that You give me!
This Joy that You alone can give!
I want to praise You with the angels,
the saints and the blessed,
because You have done this marvel for me!

Glory to You, Lord, Praise to You!
"O Lord, to You be glory, praise for ages,
O Lord, to You be glory, Eternal is Your Love!"

Blessed be You!
Honor to You!
Peoples, praise the Lord our God,
the Mighty One who works wonders for us!

Amen

en_title: Greetings to the Heart of Joseph
en_content:
We salute you, O Sacred Heart of Joseph, united in the most holy and pure love with the Sacred Heart of Mary, your spouse.

We salute you, O Sacred Heart of Joseph, chosen by God the Father, among all men, to love tenderly the Sacred Heart of Jesus, His only Son.

We salute you, O Sacred Hearts of Jesus, Mary, and Joseph, models of love, peace, fidelity, and unity for all families, we humbly ask you to keep, defend, and succor them in all their necessities.

We adore you, O Most Holy Trinity, and we give you thanks for all the gifts of the Spirit, all the Virtues, all the graces with which the Word has filled the Sacred Heart of Joseph, from all eternity, in order to accomplish in Your name, his noble and delicate mission near Jesus and Mary.

We beseech you, Adorable Trinity, to glorify the Sacred Heart of Joseph by obtaining for us, through his intercession, the graces of which we have so much need (name the graces).

Obtain for us the grace to live here below as he did in the presence of Jesus and Mary, and to die, like him, under the tender and merciful gaze of Jesus and Mary, our heart in the peace of the children of God.

Amen.

en_title: Thank You for Your Love, Lord
en_content:
Lord, deep within my heart,
I feel Your light in my heart.
Through Your love, I feel strong,
to face the trials of life.

I thank You
for the life You give me,
The work You give me
so that I can provide
for the needs of my family.
Pour out upon me Your breath of love
so that in turn I can
spread it upon my family
and the people around me.

Thank You, Lord,
for this limitless love towards me.
Remain at my side throughout my life.
Without You, I am nothing.

Amen.

Lord,
it is getting late, and the day is already waning.
In this precious moment, I want to thank you
for the days of my childhood, where I learned about life;
of my adolescence, where I learned about love;
and of the fertile years, where I sowed my seeds,
as much in my own village as in that of my neighbor.
I have gathered fruits for many years.

Lord,
before all this wealth that your light illuminates,
I turn to you and remain dazzled.

Lord,
it is getting late, and the day is already waning.
In this precious moment, I want to thank you
for the thorns and the roses, the hopes and the fruits,
the laughter and the sorrows, as well as the great joys,
the moments of tenderness and the pardons lived,
for your Word as much as for your presence,
but especially for the loves that you have sustained.

Lord,
in these final days, may your light illuminate
all that I have lived that I offer to you, thanking you!

en_title: Lord, Here I Am Before You
en_content:
Lord, here I am before You
with the men and women who are like me,
like brothers and sisters:
the poor souls who would like to get out of it,
but who cannot: the drug addicts, the lost,
the women of 'ill repute',
all those who cannot resist evil,
who steal and who kill,
all those who have lost faith, hope, charity...
and who suffer from it;

Lord, You still look at us
with that loving gaze
that You cast upon the adulterous woman,
upon the Samaritan woman, upon Mary Magdalene, upon the brigand
hanging near You:
save us, since You love us.

Lord, You said it,
You did not come for the righteous, but for the poor,
for the sick, for the sinners, for us.

Lord, I entrust us to You,
for I am sure of You,
I am sure that You save us,
I am sure that to each of us, the poor souls,
You will say on the day of our death:
this night you will be with me in Paradise,
for there will be a night when You will clothe us with Yourself,

You who are God and who became another man.
Like us You were hungry and thirsty,
like us You were afraid and You wept,
like us You died.
Your poor body was placed in the tomb,
as ours will be,
and You came out of it transfigured,
as we will one day.
My beloved, with You death is beautiful,
The Resurrection awaits us. Thank you.

en_title: Lord, You Who Were on the Cross
en_content:
Lord, You who were on the Cross,
You knew so much of physical and moral suffering,
I address this prayer to You from the depths of my heart.

I ask nothing contrary to custom,
but it is my turn to give to You.
A filial love and fidelity to thank You for the life
which You have been pleased to make me the recipient of.

For the bad times I have had to face,
Your comfort found in prayer
has always helped me to cope in such circumstances.

Often sick myself, how many times
have I addressed myself to You to relieve me of the pain.
The anxieties erased by the inner calm
that Prayer procured for me.

For others, family, friends in difficulty,
I have always asked You to protect their life and health,
You have heard me, they have recovered.

In my turn, to give to You in my own way,
My Love and that of all my loved ones.

My Fidelity without restriction
until the end of my Life.

Love shown to my Neighbor,
Availability to those around me,
Services in Your Church,
Presence with the Sick,
Missions to others.
Christian Fidelity to
all those who are in need.

Thank You, Lord, for all that You have given me,
My love for You is and will always be present.
On Your Cross, when I pray to You,
You listen to me, for I feel it, You who have suffered so much.

Amen

Say nothing.
Look at You, ask You with my eyes,
Thank You with my eyes.
Close my eyes...because You are there,
Open them...to see Your smile,
Become Your image, more and more
By dint of looking at You...
Like Your Word, Your Child,
The one of the manger
And the one of the Cross.

Thank You, Jesus,
For having come to write on the earth Your "I love you,"
And not only with Your finger,
But with Your life given,
With Your blood poured out,
And Your body laid in the earth
To raise us to life.

Today I am again amazed
by the strength that animates me.
This strength that does not come from me,
this hope that makes me understand
that nothing is impossible for me,
because the thrice-holy God
is my Lord and Savior.

I want to thank Him and give Him praise
because He makes me live each day by His grace
and nourishes me with hope for the future
and with mercy for the past.

Lord, may Your name be blessed
at all times and in every place,
may I forget none of Your benefits
and may I remain Your child.

Thank you for granting this grace
to those who ask for it,
thank you for granting us the grace of being our Father
and lacking nothing.

Blessed be the God who has set me free,
Blessed be the God who has brought me out of my tomb.
May I sing His praise every day, in all circumstances,
for He is God for eternity.

Heavenly Father, thank you!
You have chosen us,
You have desired each of us,
thank you!
Thanks to you, each receives his life
as a unique stone,
a magnificent stone
that comes to build up the body of your Son.

Heavenly Father, thank you
for the Spirit who sustains us,
for the Church which accompanies us
and helps us to find
the place where our stone will be most beautiful,
where each will give,
as in transparency,
this love that he receives from You,

Amen.

I have, in my pocket, a little cross!
A simple and silent reminder to me
That I have the joy of being Christian
Whatever I do, wherever I may be.

My little cross is not magic,
Nor a fetish, nor a lucky charm.
It is not there to ward off
Illnesses, or chance occurrences, or dangers.

Nor is it an identity card
Sometimes to brandish, sometimes to hide.
It is simply an understanding
Between Him, Savior, and me, saved.

If my hand, like this, goes to find
A key… a lighter… some change,
The brief contact makes me think again
Of the price He paid for us.

Cross that suggests to me: "Say thank you
For all the beauties of this day;
All that you do, think, or say
Can win Him a little more love."

Yes, I have in my pocket a cross!
For me alone a discreet reminder
That Jesus will reign over my life
If only I allow Him to!

For these lungs that breathe,
for this heart that beats,
for these glances, these smiles,
for the smallest gesture, the smallest step.

For all this life within me,
at every minute, at every second,
for all this life within him,
the stranger, the passerby, the friend.

For this daily miracle that no longer amazes,
for this wondrous gift that no longer dazzles.

For your goodness ceaselessly renewing life,
for your love ceaselessly multiplying life.

For this life,
and the life that you have promised us,
we walk towards You,
and say to You: Thank You!

Salve, Regína, mater misericórdiae 
vita, dulcédo et spes nostra, salve 
Ad te clamámus, éxules fílii Evae. 
Ad te suspirámus, geméntes et flentes 
in hac lacrimárum valle. 
Eia ergo, advocáta nostra, 
illos tuos misericórdes óculos 
ad nos convérte. 
Et Jesum, benedíctum frucum ventris tui, 
nobis post hoc exsílium osténde 
O clemens, o pia, o dulcis Virgo María

Tantum ergo, Sacramentum 
Veneremur cernui : 
Et antiquum documentum, 
Novo cedat ritui : 
Praestet fides suplementum, 
Sensuum defectui. 
 
Genitori, Genitoque, 
Laus et jubilatio : 
Salus, honor, virtus quoque, 
Sit et benedictio : 
Procedenti abutroque, 
Comparsit laudatio

Ave Maria, gratia plena 
Dominus tecum  
Benedicta tu in mulieribus ; 
Et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Jesus ! 
Sancta Maria, Mater Dei, 
Ora pro nobis, peccatoribus,

Amen

Regina cæli, lætare, alleluia, 
Quia quem meruisti portare, alleluia,  
Resurrexit sicut dixit, alleluia ; 
Ora pro nobis Deum, alleluia

Ave, Regina cælorum 
Ave, Domina angelorum, 
Salve, radix, salve, porta 
Ex qua mundo lux est orta. 
 
Gaude, Virgo gloriosa, 
Super omnes speciosa ; 
Vale, o valde decora 
Et pro nobis Cristum exora.

Pater noster, qui es in caelis 
sanctificetur nomen tuum 
adveniat regnum tuum 
fiat voluntas tua 
sicut in caelo et in terra. 
 
Panem nostrum quotidianum 
da nobis hodie 
et dimitte nobis debita nostra 
sicut et nos dimittimus 
debitoribus nostris 
et ne nos inducas in tentationem 
sed libera nos a malo. 
 
Amen

Credo in unum Deum, Patrem omnipotentem, factorem caeli et terrae, visibilium omnium et invisibilium. 
Et in unum Dominum Jesum Christum Filium Dei unigenitum. 
Et ex Patre natum ante omnia saecula. 
Deum de Deo, lumen de lumine, Deum verum de Deo vero. 
Genitum, non factum, consubstantialem Patri : per quem omnia facta sunt. 
Qui propter nos homines, et propter nostram salutem decendit de caelis. 
Et incarnatus est de Spiritu sancto ex Maria Virgine : Et homo factus est. 
Crucifixus etiam pro nobis : sub Pontio Pilato passus, et sepultus est. 
Et resurrexit tertia die, secundum Scripturas. 
Et ascendit in caelum : sedet ad dexteram Patris. 
Et iterum venturus est cum gloria, judicare vivos et mortuos : cujus regni non erit finis. 
Et in Spiritum sanctum, Dominum, et vivificantem : qui ex Patre Filioque procedit. 
Qui cum Patre et Filio simul adoratur, et conglorificatur : qui locutus est per Prophetas. 
Et unam, sanctam, catholicam, et apostolicam Ecclesiam. 
Confiteor unum baptisma in remissionem peccatorum. 
Et expecto resurrectionem mortuorum. Et vitam venturi saeculi. 
 
Amen

My God, I offer You all the actions
I will perform today, for the intentions
and for the glory of the Sacred Heart of Jesus;
I wish to sanctify the beats of my heart,
my thoughts, and my simplest works
by uniting them to His Infinite Merits,
and to repair my faults by casting them
into the furnace of His Merciful Love.

O my God!
I ask You for me
and for those who are dear to me
the grace to perfectly fulfill Your Holy Will, to accept for Your Love the joys
and sorrows of this fleeting life
so that one day we may be reunited
in heaven for all eternity.

Lord,
my day begins.
You give it to me freely.
I want to live it inspired by You,
avoiding all criticism, all complaint.
Grant me to serve You in others.
Pour Your peace into me.
May Your divine Spirit, in the manner of Mary,
fill my relationships today
with love.
I want what You want, as You want it,
when You want it.

Lord, this day is ending and I come to you to offer you my day with all that I was able to put into it, both good and less good.
For all the good I have done today, I thank you, for it is thanks to your help that I was able to be useful to others.
In your mercy, forgive me my negligence and my faults of this day.
Pardon my mediocrity and my omissions. Do not take into account the lack of consideration and attention of which I may have been guilty today.
With confidence, I place myself in your hands, I entrust to you my sleep, my thoughts,
my joys and my sorrows, knowing that you are ready to forgive my weaknesses
and to assure me of your help so that tomorrow I can return to your service
and to the service of all those who are dear to me.

Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
for he has visited and redeemed his people.
He has raised up for us a mighty savior
in the house of David his servant,

as he promised through the mouth
of his holy prophets from ages past:
salvation from our enemies
and from the hand of all who hate us.

He has shown mercy to our fathers
and remembered his holy covenant,
the oath he swore to Abraham our father,
that he would grant us
that we, being rescued from the hands of our enemies,
might serve him without fear,
in holiness and righteousness before him,
all our days.

And you, child,
will be called prophet of the Most High,
for you will go before the Lord
to prepare his ways,
to give his people knowledge of salvation
through the forgiveness of their sins,

because of the tender mercy of our God
by which the daybreak from on high will visit us,
to shine on those who sit in darkness and death’s shadow,
to guide our feet into the path of peace.

Blessed are you, Lord!

Blessed are you, Lord, for the triumphant morning
announced by the countless concert of birds,
for the rain that rings out,
the joy of a new day,
for the scent of freshly cut hay
and for the drone
that echoes the church bell.

Blessed are you, Lord, for the murmur of the spring,
for the pink and blue mountains,
and for the lark
whose flight is lost in the firmament,
for the warm caress of the sun,
for the dazzling broom,
and for the mauve lavender,
for the industrious ant and for the buzzing and busy bee...
for the olive tree that shines in the glory of noon...

Blessed are you, Lord, for the soft light of evening
that lays like a diaphanous veil on the mountain,
for the cool and fragrant breeze of the night,
for the enraptured nightingale.
Blessed are you for all the smiles of the world
that you have fashioned for us with art and tenderness
and that we no longer know
how to contemplate well, so often.
For the gladness of the morning,
the splendor of noon
and the sweetness of the evening.

Blessed are you, Lord.

Now, O Sovereign Lord,
you may let your servant go in peace
according to your word,

for my eyes have seen your salvation
which you have prepared in the sight of all peoples,

a light for revelation to the Gentiles,
and for glory to your people Israel.

Now that the screen is already lit
and the keyboard awaits only the diligent touch of my fingers,
I address myself to You, Lord,
in the certainty that I will also encounter You
on these anonymous paths of the Internet
that traverse the world,
paths created by the need of humanity
to communicate with others,
in the happy purpose of negating distances.

Teach us, Lord, to use this means with profit and moderation
and help us to avoid the perils of our journey:
may we not be overwhelmed by the surfeit of information,
may deceptive and empty appearances not delude us,
may we know how to distance ourselves from every kind of unworthy enslavement,
from the blindness of univocal thought,
and from the faceless path of dehumanization.
And finally,
when the screen is again extinguished
and we have the vain impression of having learned something,
remind us that knowing and knowledge
are much more than this fragmentary information
that has fleetingly passed before our eyes,
and that the world will always be vaster
than what we seemed to understand,
for it reaches the deepest part of each person
only to be lost afterwards in the immense horizon of Your Fatherly heart.

Amen.

On my forehead or in my hands,
the ashes speak of earth, the earth from which I come,
the earth I inhabit to change it, to transform it,
and at the same time, to transform my heart.

My hands covered in ashes,
marked with my sin and failed endeavors,
before You, Lord, I open them,
so that they may become capable of building again
and so that you may remove their impurity.

My hands, clenched on my possessions
and my preconceived notions,
before You, Lord, I open them,
so that they may release my treasures.

My hands, ready to tear and to wound,
before You, Lord, I open them,
so that they may become capable of tenderness.

My hands, closed like fists
of hatred and violence,
before You, Lord, I open them,
You will place tenderness within them.

My hands separate from their sin:
before You, Lord, I open them:
I await your forgiveness.

In the hollow of my hands or on my forehead,
the ashes to tell me:
return to the everyday reality of each day,
without forgetting the dream.

The mark of the ashes,
on my forehead or in my hands,
shows me a path:
It is in returning to God
that I can return to myself
and reconcile myself with myself.

It's Christmas!
The Son of God is born!
Like the shepherds,
we come near to you, Jesus,
to sing you a new song!
What a gift!

It's Christmas!
The Son of God is born!
Like the shepherds,
we kneel down, Jesus,
to thank you for being among us.
What joy!

It's Christmas!
The Son of God is born!
For you, Jesus,
the earth dances with joy,
and the trees of the forests
whisper the Good News.
All the inhabitants of the earth rejoice.
What a feast!

Glory to God in the highest,
and peace on earth
to those on whom his favor rests!

Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love;
according to your abundant mercy blot out my transgressions.
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
and cleanse me from my sin!

For I know my transgressions,
and my sin is ever before me.
Against you, you only, have I sinned
and done what is evil in your sight,
so that you are justified in your words
and blameless in your judgment.

Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity,
and in sin did my mother conceive me.
Behold, you delight in truth in the inward being,
and you teach me wisdom in the secret heart.
Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

Let me hear joy and gladness;
let the bones that you have broken rejoice.
Hide your face from my sins,
and blot out all my iniquities.

Create in me a clean heart, O God,
and renew a right spirit within me.
Cast me not away from your presence,
and take not your Holy Spirit from me.

Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
and uphold me with a willing spirit.
Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
and sinners will return to you.

Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God,
O God of my salvation,
and my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.
O Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will declare your praise.

For you will not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it;
you will not be pleased with a burnt offering.
The sacrifice acceptable to God is a broken spirit;
a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

Do good to Zion in your good pleasure;
build up the walls of Jerusalem;
then will you delight in right sacrifices,
in burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings;
then bulls will be offered on your altar.

en_title: Christmas: Jesus, come open our homes and our hearts
en_content:
Christmas: Jesus, come open our homes and our hearts.

Jesus, where You were born,
Your manger was not closed.
You willed
that everyone could come to see You,
because You came for everyone.

Before You were born, Jesus,
Joseph and Mary found
only houses with closed doors:
closed to the secret of God.
They found an open stable,
a poor stable.

Today, Jesus,
You are no longer born in a stable;
but You want to be born, to speak the secret of God
in all homes, in all hearts.

You want to place the kiss of God
on every face.
You want millions of mangers
to inhabit the world.
You want millions of hearts
to give Your peace on earth.
You want millions of faces
to give the peace of God.
You want millions of Christmases
to give Your Christmas.

Jesus, come open our homes and our hearts
to say with You:
Glory to God, our Father!

From my childhood,
you have placed upon my soul
your light, that source of life
to shine for others.
Yet today, I see it there,
frozen, paralyzed,
lying deep within me
like a marble stone.

So, in this time of Advent,
I stand before you
awaiting the miracle of Christmas:
I would only want you to help me,
Lord, to restore movement
to your light in my life.
This desire for you which has endured
throughout all my days...
Take it.
I know what you can do with little.

And still, do not forget those who surround me
and whom I love, and even those I love less.
And also those far away whom I do not know.
Finally, all those who inhabit our earth
threatened today with losing your light.
Lord, please, prepare us for the miracle of Christmas!

Lord my God, grant my heart to desire you; desiring you, to seek you; seeking you, to find you; finding you, to love you; and loving you, to redeem my sins; and once redeemed, to sin no more.

Lord my God, grant my heart penance, my spirit repentance, my eyes a fount of tears, and my hands the generosity of almsgiving.

You who are my King, extinguish within me the desires of the flesh, and kindle the fire of your love. You who are my Redeemer, drive from me the spirit of pride, and may your loving-kindness grant me the spirit of your humility. You who are my Savior, remove from me the fury of anger, and may your goodness grant me the shield of patience.

You who are my Creator, uproot from my soul rancor, to pour forth therein gentleness of spirit. Grant me, most good Father, a firm faith, a sure hope, and a charity without fail.

You who lead me, remove from me vanity of soul, inconstancy of spirit, straying of heart, flatteries of the mouth, and pride of the gaze.

O God of mercy, I ask you through your beloved Son, grant me to live mercy, application to piety, compassion with the afflicted, and sharing with the poor.
